com.nxp.id.jcopx
Class CipherX

java.lang.Object
  com.nxp.id.jcopx.CipherX

public final class CipherX
extends java.lang.Object

CipherX defines static methods that can be used to generate Java Card objects that implement JCOP-specific cipher objects. It currently defines the following fields and methods:

Field Summary
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_CBC_FPAD
          Cipher algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_CBC_FPAD provides a cipher using the Korean SEED algorithm specified in the Korean SEED Algorithm specification provided by KISA, Korea Information Security Agency in ECB mode .
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_CBC_NRPAD
          Cipher algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_CBC_NRPAD provides a cipher using the Korean SEED algorithm specified in the Korean SEED Algorithm specification provided by KISA, Korea Information Security Agency in ECB mode.
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_ECB_FPAD
          Cipher algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_ECB_FPAD provides a cipher using the Korean SEED algorithm specified in the Korean SEED Algorithm specification provided by KISA, Korea Information Security Agency in ECB mode.
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_ECB_NRPAD
          Cipher algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_ECB_NRPAD provides a cipher using the Korean SEED algorithm specified in the Korean SEED Algorithm specification provided by KISA, Korea Information Security Agency in ECB mode.
 
Method Summary
static javacardx.crypto.Cipher getInstance(byte algorithm, boolean externalAccess)
          Creates a Cipher object instance of the selected algorithm.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

getInstance

public static javacardx.crypto.Cipher getInstance(byte algorithm,
                                                  boolean externalAccess)
Creates a Cipher object instance of the selected algorithm.

Parameters:
algorithm - the desired Cipher algorithm. Valid codes listed in ALG_ .. constants above e.g. ALG_KOREAN_SEED_CBC_NOPAD
externalAccess - true indicates that the instance will be shared among multiple applet instances and that the Cipher instance will also be accessed (via a Shareable interface) when the owner of the Signature instance is not the currently selected applet.
Returns:
the Cipher object instance of the requested algorithm
Throws:
CryptoException - with the following reason codes:
  • CryptoException.NO_SUCH_ALGORITHM if the requested algorithm or shared access mode is not supported.
